processed_nodes.label: To-do list
processed_nodes.problem_description: The node represents a specific personal document, but its generic label conflicts with the specific scope described. Classification looks correct; description is clear. Main issue is naming ambiguity and lack of aliases.
processed_nodes.resolution_notes:
- Rename label to a disambiguated form, e.g., "Jukka's to-do list" or "To-do list (Jukka)"; ensure a unique slug/canonical_name.
- Add aliases to improve retrieval: ["Todo list", "To do list", "TODO", "Task list", "Personal to-do list", "Jukka task tracker"]. Include common hyphenation variants.
- Improve connectivity (target at least 3-5 meaningful edges):
  - maintained_by/owned_by -> Jukka (Person)
  - instance_of -> To-do list (concept)
  - hosted_on/located_in -> the app or system used (e.g., Todoist/Notion/Reminders) if known
  - contains -> Task nodes or links to Projects/Areas
  - related_to -> Productivity, Time management, Planning
  - references/syncs_with -> Calendar or Project management system if applicable
- If multiple lists exist (work vs personal), encode scope in the label or add attribute scope=personal/work; otherwise note scope=personal+work.
- Normalize punctuation (ASCII apostrophe) and ensure consistent capitalization/style.
- Review importance; if this is a central reference, raise importance to ~0.7-0.8.
- Verify there is a separate concept node for the general idea of a to-do list; link via instance_of and avoid conflation/duplication. Merge duplicates if found.
- Inspect the existing edge with unknown->unknown; fix predicate/direction and ensure proper typing.
- Optionally add metadata: privacy_level=private and location_uri/source_system for traceability.
